radiographic_examinations.findings: Diffuse pulmonary edema, diffuse interstitial infiltrates, small bilateral pleural effusions.
Severe left ventricular systolic dysfunction, left ventricular ejection fraction of 15%, left ventricular apical akinesis, severe right ventricular apical dysfunction, small pericardial effusion.
Mildly reduced left ventricular ejection fraction of 49%, left ventricular mid-to-apical hypokinesis, normal right ventricular function, no evidence of clinically significant myocardial edema.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially low left ventricular ejection fraction, improved to 54% preoperatively after treatment.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Acute and healing myocardial injury, focal necrotic myocytes, and a reparative inflammatory infiltrate primarily composed of CD68+ macrophages.
Ellipsoid mass located anterior to the superior pole of the right kidney, suggestive of pheochromocytoma.
